StoicQuote.Quote: You have power over your mind—not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
StoicQuote.Author: Marcus Aurelius

StoicQuote.Quote: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
StoicQuote.Author: Seneca

StoicQuote.Quote: It is not things themselves that disturb us, but our opinions about them.
StoicQuote.Author: Epictetus

StoicQuote.Quote: He who fears death will never do anything worth of a man who is alive.
StoicQuote.Author: Seneca

StoicQuote.Quote: If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself but to your estimate of it —and this you have the power to revoke at any moment.
StoicQuote.Author: Marcus Aurelius

StoicQuote.Quote: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.
StoicQuote.Author: Epictetus

StoicQuote.Quote: No man is free who is not master of himself.
StoicQuote.Author: Epictetus

StoicQuote.Quote: Waste no more time arguing what a good man should be. Be one.
StoicQuote.Author: Marcus Aurelius

StoicQuote.Quote: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
StoicQuote.Author: Seneca

StoicQuote.Quote: The best revenge is not to be like your enemy.
StoicQuote.Author: Marcus Aurelius
